title: [BUG] Identify cause and fix CI/CD stuck in loop on unix, mac - reproduction & diagnostics appreciated

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

body:
Since yesterday evening, CI/CD on `main` and PR branching off it have `test-linux` and `test-mac` getting stuck in a loop, running for hours.
Strangely, the "run test" element does not produce any logs, while running (unlike `test-windows`).

There does not seem to be a clear reason or a clear culprit among PRs.
Local runs on windows do not show any problem, nor do the remote runs of `test-windows`.
@lmmentel who has a unix set-up said he could reproduce the issue locally, earlier today.

The problem was solved by skipping `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` (via #1953), but that is not a permanent solution.
The reason for the issue is still unclear, or why it started to appear suddenly without a clear trigger.
We need to identify and fix, optimally bringing back `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` (or a fixed version thereof)0 at some point.

For purposes of diagnosis, I am leaving the below draft PR open or linked.

---

Keeping track of attempted fixes:
* revert #1910, in #1938 - no change
* revert #1758, in #1948 - test break because linting is reverted
* fix numba version #1945 - no change
* revert numba/cython varia from last 2 days #1951 - no change
* parameters in `FreshPRINCE` #1944 - no change
* remove `test_all_estimators` entirely #1946 - runs!
* #1946, version where ony *class* tests are run - no change
* perhaps the new testing framework does not have the issue #1833 (updated from main) - no change
* removing some vaguely suspicious tests from `test_all_estimators` #1952 - runs on linux and mac!!
* adding back classes (not instances) to #1946 successively #1949
* removing `test_multiprocessing_idempotent` #1953 - runs on linux and mac!
